3013 /*
3014  * List all known file names (for :files and :buffers command).
3015  */
3016  void
3017 buflist_list(exarg_T *eap)
3018 {
3019  buf_T *buf;
3020  int len;
3021  int i;
3022  int ro_char;
3023  int changed_char;
3024 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
3025  int job_running;
3026  int job_none_open;
3027 #endif
3028 
3029  for (buf = firstbuf; buf != NULL && !got_int; buf = buf->b_next)
3030  {
3031 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
3032  job_running = term_job_running(buf->b_term);
3033  job_none_open = job_running && term_none_open(buf->b_term);
3034 #endif
3035  /* skip unlisted buffers, unless ! was used */
3036  if ((!buf->b_p_bl && !eap->forceit && !vim_strchr(eap->arg, 'u'))
3037  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, 'u') && buf->b_p_bl)
3038  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, '+')
3039  && ((buf->b_flags & BF_READERR) || !bufIsChanged(buf)))
3040  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, 'a')
3041  && (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL || buf->b_nwindows == 0))
3042  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, 'h')
3043  && (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL || buf->b_nwindows != 0))
3044 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
3045  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, 'R')
3046  && (!job_running || (job_running && job_none_open)))
3047  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, '?')
3048  && (!job_running || (job_running && !job_none_open)))
3049  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, 'F')
3050  && (job_running || buf->b_term == NULL))
3051 #endif
3052  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, '-') && buf->b_p_ma)
3053  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, '=') && !buf->b_p_ro)
3054  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, 'x') && !(buf->b_flags & BF_READERR))
3055  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, '%') && buf != curbuf)
3056  || (vim_strchr(eap->arg, '#')
3057  && (buf == curbuf || curwin->w_alt_fnum != buf->b_fnum)))
3058  continue;
3059  if (buf_spname(buf) != NULL)
3060  vim_strncpy(NameBuff, buf_spname(buf), MAXPATHL - 1);
3061  else
3062  home_replace(buf, buf->b_fname, NameBuff, MAXPATHL, TRUE);
3063  if (message_filtered(NameBuff))
3064  continue;
3065 
3066  changed_char = (buf->b_flags & BF_READERR) ? 'x'
3067  : (bufIsChanged(buf) ? '+' : ' ');
3068 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
3069  if (term_job_running(buf->b_term))
3070  {
3071  if (term_none_open(buf->b_term))
3072  ro_char = '?';
3073  else
3074  ro_char = 'R';
3075  changed_char = ' '; /* bufIsChanged() returns TRUE to avoid
3076  * closing, but it's not actually changed. */
3077  }
3078  else if (buf->b_term != NULL)
3079  ro_char = 'F';
3080  else
3081 #endif
3082  ro_char = !buf->b_p_ma ? '-' : (buf->b_p_ro ? '=' : ' ');
3083 
3084  msg_putchar('\n');
3085  len = vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE - 20, "%3d%c%c%c%c%c \"%s\"",
3086  buf->b_fnum,
3087  buf->b_p_bl ? ' ' : 'u',
3088  buf == curbuf ? '%' :
3089  (curwin->w_alt_fnum == buf->b_fnum ? '#' : ' '),
3090  buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL ? ' ' :
3091  (buf->b_nwindows == 0 ? 'h' : 'a'),
3092  ro_char,
3093  changed_char,
3094  NameBuff);
3095  if (len > IOSIZE - 20)
3096  len = IOSIZE - 20;
3097 
3098  /* put "line 999" in column 40 or after the file name */
3099  i = 40 - vim_strsize(IObuff);
3100  do
3101  IObuff[len++] = ' ';
3102  while (--i > 0 && len < IOSIZE - 18);
3103  vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff + len, (size_t)(IOSIZE - len),
3104  _("line %ld"), buf == curbuf ? curwin->w_cursor.lnum
3105  : (long)buflist_findlnum(buf));
3106  msg_outtrans(IObuff);
3107  out_flush(); /* output one line at a time */
3108  ui_breakcheck();
3109  }
3110 }
3111 
3112 /*
3113  * Get file name and line number for file 'fnum'.
3114  * Used by DoOneCmd() for translating '%' and '#'.
3115  * Used by insert_reg() and cmdline_paste() for '#' register.
3116  * Return FAIL if not found, OK for success.
3117  */
3118  int
3119 buflist_name_nr(
3120  int fnum,
3121  char_u **fname,
3122  linenr_T *lnum)

3124  buf_T *buf;
3125 
3126  buf = buflist_findnr(fnum);
3127  if (buf == NULL || buf->b_fname == NULL)
3128  return FAIL;
3129 
3130  *fname = buf->b_fname;
3131  *lnum = buflist_findlnum(buf);
3132 
3133  return OK;
3134 }

3136 /*
3137  * Set the file name for "buf"' to "ffname_arg", short file name to
3138  * "sfname_arg".
3139  * The file name with the full path is also remembered, for when :cd is used.
3140  * Returns FAIL for failure (file name already in use by other buffer)
3141  * OK otherwise.
3142  */
3143  int
3144 setfname(
3145  buf_T *buf,
3146  char_u *ffname_arg,
3147  char_u *sfname_arg,
3148  int message) /* give message when buffer already exists */
3149 {
3150  char_u *ffname = ffname_arg;
3151  char_u *sfname = sfname_arg;
3152  buf_T *obuf = NULL;
3153 #ifdef UNIX
3154  stat_T st;
3155 #endif
3156 
3157  if (ffname == NULL || *ffname == NUL)
3158  {
3159  /* Removing the name. */
3160  if (buf->b_sfname != buf->b_ffname)
3161  VIM_CLEAR(buf->b_sfname);
3162  else
3163  buf->b_sfname = NULL;
3164  VIM_CLEAR(buf->b_ffname);
3165 #ifdef UNIX
3166  st.st_dev = (dev_T)-1;
3167 #endif
3168  }
3169  else
3170  {
3171  fname_expand(buf, &ffname, &sfname); /* will allocate ffname */
3172  if (ffname == NULL) /* out of memory */
3173  return FAIL;
3174 
3175  /*
3176  * if the file name is already used in another buffer:
3177  * - if the buffer is loaded, fail
3178  * - if the buffer is not loaded, delete it from the list
3179  */
3180 #ifdef UNIX
3181  if (mch_stat((char *)ffname, &st) < 0)
3182  st.st_dev = (dev_T)-1;
3183 #endif
3184  if (!(buf->b_flags & BF_DUMMY))
3185 #ifdef UNIX
3186  obuf = buflist_findname_stat(ffname, &st);
3187 #else
3188  obuf = buflist_findname(ffname);
3189 #endif
3190  if (obuf != NULL && obuf != buf)
3191  {
3192  if (obuf->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL) /* it's loaded, fail */
3193  {
3194  if (message)
3195  emsg(_("E95: Buffer with this name already exists"));
3196  vim_free(ffname);
3197  return FAIL;
3198  }
3199  /* delete from the list */
3200  close_buffer(NULL, obuf, DOBUF_WIPE, FALSE);
3201  }
3202  sfname = vim_strsave(sfname);
3203  if (ffname == NULL || sfname == NULL)
3204  {
3205  vim_free(sfname);
3206  vim_free(ffname);
3207  return FAIL;
3208  }
3209 #ifdef USE_FNAME_CASE
3210  fname_case(sfname, 0); /* set correct case for short file name */
3211 #endif
3212  if (buf->b_sfname != buf->b_ffname)
3213  vim_free(buf->b_sfname);
3214  vim_free(buf->b_ffname);
3215  buf->b_ffname = ffname;
3216  buf->b_sfname = sfname;
3217  }
3218  buf->b_fname = buf->b_sfname;
3219 #ifdef UNIX
3220  if (st.st_dev == (dev_T)-1)
3221  buf->b_dev_valid = FALSE;
3222  else
3223  {
3224  buf->b_dev_valid = TRUE;
3225  buf->b_dev = st.st_dev;
3226  buf->b_ino = st.st_ino;
3227  }
3228 #endif
3229 
3230  buf->b_shortname = FALSE;
3231 
3232  buf_name_changed(buf);
3233  return OK;
3234 }

3236 /*
3237  * Crude way of changing the name of a buffer. Use with care!
3238  * The name should be relative to the current directory.
3239  */
3240  void
3241 buf_set_name(int fnum, char_u *name)
3242 {
3243  buf_T *buf;
3244 
3245  buf = buflist_findnr(fnum);
3246  if (buf != NULL)
3247  {
3248  if (buf->b_sfname != buf->b_ffname)
3249  vim_free(buf->b_sfname);
3250  vim_free(buf->b_ffname);
3251  buf->b_ffname = vim_strsave(name);
3252  buf->b_sfname = NULL;
3253  /* Allocate ffname and expand into full path. Also resolves .lnk
3254  * files on Win32. */
3255  fname_expand(buf, &buf->b_ffname, &buf->b_sfname);
3256  buf->b_fname = buf->b_sfname;
3257  }

3260 /*
3261  * Take care of what needs to be done when the name of buffer "buf" has
3262  * changed.
3263  */
3264  void
3265 buf_name_changed(buf_T *buf)
3266 {
3267  /*
3268  * If the file name changed, also change the name of the swapfile
3269  */
3270  if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL)
3271  ml_setname(buf);
3272 
3273  if (curwin->w_buffer == buf)

3277 #endif

3279  fmarks_check_names(buf); /* check named file marks */
3280  ml_timestamp(buf); /* reset timestamp */
3281 }

3383 
3384  static int
3385 otherfile_buf(
3386  buf_T *buf,
3387  char_u *ffname
3388 #ifdef UNIX
3389  , stat_T *stp
3390 #endif
3391  )
3392 {
3393  /* no name is different */
3394  if (ffname == NULL || *ffname == NUL || buf->b_ffname == NULL)
3395  return TRUE;
3396  if (fnamecmp(ffname, buf->b_ffname) == 0)
3397  return FALSE;
3398 #ifdef UNIX
3399  {
3400  stat_T st;
3401 
3402  /* If no stat_T given, get it now */
3403  if (stp == NULL)
3404  {
3405  if (!buf->b_dev_valid || mch_stat((char *)ffname, &st) < 0)
3406  st.st_dev = (dev_T)-1;
3407  stp = &st;
3408  }
3409  /* Use dev/ino to check if the files are the same, even when the names
3410  * are different (possible with links). Still need to compare the
3411  * name above, for when the file doesn't exist yet.
3412  * Problem: The dev/ino changes when a file is deleted (and created
3413  * again) and remains the same when renamed/moved. We don't want to
3414  * mch_stat() each buffer each time, that would be too slow. Get the
3415  * dev/ino again when they appear to match, but not when they appear
3416  * to be different: Could skip a buffer when it's actually the same
3417  * file. */
3418  if (buf_same_ino(buf, stp))
3419  {
3420  buf_setino(buf);
3421  if (buf_same_ino(buf, stp))
3422  return FALSE;
3423  }
3424  }
3425 #endif
3426  return TRUE;
3427 }
3428 
3429 #if defined(UNIX) || defined(PROTO)
3430 /*
3431  * Set inode and device number for a buffer.
3432  * Must always be called when b_fname is changed!.
3433  */
3434  void
3435 buf_setino(buf_T *buf)
3436 {
3437  stat_T st;
3438 
3439  if (buf->b_fname != NULL && mch_stat((char *)buf->b_fname, &st) >= 0)
3440  {
3441  buf->b_dev_valid = TRUE;
3442  buf->b_dev = st.st_dev;
3443  buf->b_ino = st.st_ino;
3444  }
3445  else
3446  buf->b_dev_valid = FALSE;
3447 }
3448 
3449 /*
3450  * Return TRUE if dev/ino in buffer "buf" matches with "stp".
3451  */
3452  static int
3453 buf_same_ino(
3454  buf_T *buf,
3455  stat_T *stp)
3456 {
3457  return (buf->b_dev_valid
3458  && stp->st_dev == buf->b_dev
3459  && stp->st_ino == buf->b_ino);
3460 }

3463 /*
3464  * Print info about the current buffer.
3465  */
3466  void
3467 fileinfo(
3468  int fullname, /* when non-zero print full path */
3469  int shorthelp,
3470  int dont_truncate)
3471 {
3472  char_u *name;
3473  int n;
3474  char *p;
3475  char *buffer;
3476  size_t len;
3477 
3478  buffer = alloc(IOSIZE);
3479  if (buffer == NULL)
3480  return;
3481 
3482  if (fullname > 1) /* 2 CTRL-G: include buffer number */
3483  {
3484  vim_snprintf(buffer, IOSIZE, "buf %d: ", curbuf->b_fnum);
3485  p = buffer + STRLEN(buffer);
3486  }
3487  else
3488  p = buffer;
3489 
3490  *p++ = '"';
3491  if (buf_spname(curbuf) != NULL)
3492  vim_strncpy((char_u *)p, buf_spname(curbuf), IOSIZE - (p - buffer) - 1);
3493  else
3494  {
3495  if (!fullname && curbuf->b_fname != NULL)
3496  name = curbuf->b_fname;
3497  else
3498  name = curbuf->b_ffname;
3499  home_replace(shorthelp ? curbuf : NULL, name, (char_u *)p,
3500  (int)(IOSIZE - (p - buffer)), TRUE);
3501  }
3502 
3503  vim_snprintf_add(buffer, IOSIZE, "\"%s%s%s%s%s%s",
3504  curbufIsChanged() ? (shortmess(SHM_MOD)
3505  ? " [+]" : _(" [Modified]")) : " ",
3506  (curbuf->b_flags & BF_NOTEDITED)
3507 #ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
3508  && !bt_dontwrite(curbuf)
3509 #endif
3510  ? _("[Not edited]") : "",
3511  (curbuf->b_flags & BF_NEW)
3512 #ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
3513  && !bt_dontwrite(curbuf)
3514 #endif
3515  ? _("[New file]") : "",
3516  (curbuf->b_flags & BF_READERR) ? _("[Read errors]") : "",
3517  curbuf->b_p_ro ? (shortmess(SHM_RO) ? _("[RO]")
3518  : _("[readonly]")) : "",
3519  (curbufIsChanged() || (curbuf->b_flags & BF_WRITE_MASK)
3520  || curbuf->b_p_ro) ?
3521  " " : "");
3522  /* With 32 bit longs and more than 21,474,836 lines multiplying by 100
3523  * causes an overflow, thus for large numbers divide instead. */
3524  if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1000000L)
3525  n = (int)(((long)curwin->w_cursor.lnum) /
3526  ((long)curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count / 100L));
3527  else
3528  n = (int)(((long)curwin->w_cursor.lnum * 100L) /
3529  (long)curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count);
3530  if (curbuf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY)
3531  vim_snprintf_add(buffer, IOSIZE, "%s", _(no_lines_msg));
3532 #ifdef FEAT_CMDL_INFO
3533  else if (p_ru)
3534  /* Current line and column are already on the screen -- webb */
3535  vim_snprintf_add(buffer, IOSIZE,
3536  NGETTEXT("%ld line --%d%%--", "%ld lines --%d%%--",
3537  curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count),
3538  (long)curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count, n);
3539 #endif
3540  else
3541  {
3542  vim_snprintf_add(buffer, IOSIZE,
3543  _("line %ld of %ld --%d%%-- col "),
3544  (long)curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
3545  (long)curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count,
3546  n);
3547  validate_virtcol();
3548  len = STRLEN(buffer);
3549  col_print((char_u *)buffer + len, IOSIZE - len,
3550  (int)curwin->w_cursor.col + 1, (int)curwin->w_virtcol + 1);
3551  }
3552 
3553  (void)append_arg_number(curwin, (char_u *)buffer, IOSIZE,
3554  !shortmess(SHM_FILE));
3555 
3556  if (dont_truncate)
3557  {
3558  /* Temporarily set msg_scroll to avoid the message being truncated.
3559  * First call msg_start() to get the message in the right place. */
3560  msg_start();
3561  n = msg_scroll;
3562  msg_scroll = TRUE;
3563  msg(buffer);
3564  msg_scroll = n;
3565  }
3566  else
3567  {
3568  p = (char *)msg_trunc_attr(buffer, FALSE, 0);
3569  if (restart_edit != 0 || (msg_scrolled && !need_wait_return))
3570  /* Need to repeat the message after redrawing when:
3571  * - When restart_edit is set (otherwise there will be a delay
3572  * before redrawing).
3573  * - When the screen was scrolled but there is no wait-return
3574  * prompt. */
3575  set_keep_msg((char_u *)p, 0);
3576  }
3577 
3578  vim_free(buffer);
3579 }
3580 
3581  void
3582 col_print(
3583  char_u *buf,
3584  size_t buflen,
3585  int col,
3586  int vcol)
3587 {
3588  if (col == vcol)
3589  vim_snprintf((char *)buf, buflen, "%d", col);
3590  else
3591  vim_snprintf((char *)buf, buflen, "%d-%d", col, vcol);
3592 }

3594 #if defined(FEAT_TITLE) || defined(PROTO)
3595 static char_u *lasttitle = NULL;
3596 static char_u *lasticon = NULL;
3597 
3598 /*
3599  * Put the file name in the title bar and icon of the window.
3600  */
3601  void
3602 maketitle(void)
3603 {
3604  char_u *p;
3605  char_u *title_str = NULL;
3606  char_u *icon_str = NULL;
3607  int maxlen = 0;
3608  int len;
3609  int mustset;
3610  char_u buf[IOSIZE];
3611  int off;
3612 
3613  if (!redrawing())
3614  {
3615  /* Postpone updating the title when 'lazyredraw' is set. */
3616  need_maketitle = TRUE;
3617  return;
3618  }
3619 
3620  need_maketitle = FALSE;
3621  if (!p_title && !p_icon && lasttitle == NULL && lasticon == NULL)
3622  return; // nothing to do
3623 
3624  if (p_title)
3625  {
3626  if (p_titlelen > 0)
3627  {
3628  maxlen = p_titlelen * Columns / 100;
3629  if (maxlen < 10)
3630  maxlen = 10;
3631  }
3632 
3633  title_str = buf;
3634  if (*p_titlestring != NUL)
3635  {
3636 #ifdef FEAT_STL_OPT
3637  if (stl_syntax & STL_IN_TITLE)
3638  {
3639  int use_sandbox = FALSE;
3640  int save_called_emsg = called_emsg;
3641 
3642 # ifdef FEAT_EVAL
3643  use_sandbox = was_set_insecurely((char_u *)"titlestring", 0);
3644 # endif
3645  called_emsg = FALSE;
3646  build_stl_str_hl(curwin, title_str, sizeof(buf),
3647  p_titlestring, use_sandbox,
3648  0, maxlen, NULL, NULL);
3649  if (called_emsg)
3650  set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"titlestring", -1,
3651  (char_u *)"", OPT_FREE, SID_ERROR);
3652  called_emsg |= save_called_emsg;
3653  }
3654  else
3655 #endif
3656  title_str = p_titlestring;
3657  }
3658  else
3659  {
3660  /* format: "fname + (path) (1 of 2) - VIM" */
3661 
3662 #define SPACE_FOR_FNAME (IOSIZE - 100)
3663 #define SPACE_FOR_DIR (IOSIZE - 20)
3664 #define SPACE_FOR_ARGNR (IOSIZE - 10) /* at least room for " - VIM" */
3665  if (curbuf->b_fname == NULL)
3666  vim_strncpy(buf, (char_u *)_("[No Name]"), SPACE_FOR_FNAME);
3667 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
3668  else if (curbuf->b_term != NULL)
3669  {
3670  vim_strncpy(buf, term_get_status_text(curbuf->b_term),
3671  SPACE_FOR_FNAME);
3672  }
3673 #endif
3674  else
3675  {
3676  p = transstr(gettail(curbuf->b_fname));
3677  vim_strncpy(buf, p, SPACE_FOR_FNAME);
3678  vim_free(p);
3679  }
3680 
3681 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
3682  if (curbuf->b_term == NULL)
3683 #endif
3684  switch (bufIsChanged(curbuf)
3685  + (curbuf->b_p_ro * 2)
3686  + (!curbuf->b_p_ma * 4))
3687  {
3688  case 1: STRCAT(buf, " +"); break;
3689  case 2: STRCAT(buf, " ="); break;
3690  case 3: STRCAT(buf, " =+"); break;
3691  case 4:
3692  case 6: STRCAT(buf, " -"); break;
3693  case 5:
3694  case 7: STRCAT(buf, " -+"); break;
3695  }
3696 
3697  if (curbuf->b_fname != NULL
3698 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
3699  && curbuf->b_term == NULL
3700 #endif
3701  )
3702  {
3703  /* Get path of file, replace home dir with ~ */
3704  off = (int)STRLEN(buf);
3705  buf[off++] = ' ';
3706  buf[off++] = '(';
3707  home_replace(curbuf, curbuf->b_ffname,
3708  buf + off, SPACE_FOR_DIR - off, TRUE);
3709 #ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
3710  /* avoid "c:/name" to be reduced to "c" */
3711  if (isalpha(buf[off]) && buf[off + 1] == ':')
3712  off += 2;
3713 #endif
3714  /* remove the file name */
3715  p = gettail_sep(buf + off);
3716  if (p == buf + off)
3717  {
3718  /* must be a help buffer */
3719  vim_strncpy(buf + off, (char_u *)_("help"),
3720  (size_t)(SPACE_FOR_DIR - off - 1));
3721  }
3722  else
3723  *p = NUL;
3724 
3725  /* Translate unprintable chars and concatenate. Keep some
3726  * room for the server name. When there is no room (very long
3727  * file name) use (...). */
3728  if (off < SPACE_FOR_DIR)
3729  {
3730  p = transstr(buf + off);
3731  vim_strncpy(buf + off, p, (size_t)(SPACE_FOR_DIR - off));
3732  vim_free(p);
3733  }
3734  else
3735  {
3736  vim_strncpy(buf + off, (char_u *)"...",
3737  (size_t)(SPACE_FOR_ARGNR - off));
3738  }
3739  STRCAT(buf, ")");
3740  }
3741 
3742  append_arg_number(curwin, buf, SPACE_FOR_ARGNR, FALSE);
3743 
3744 #if defined(FEAT_CLIENTSERVER)
3745  if (serverName != NULL)
3746  {
3747  STRCAT(buf, " - ");
3748  vim_strcat(buf, serverName, IOSIZE);
3749  }
3750  else
3751 #endif
3752  STRCAT(buf, " - VIM");
3753 
3754  if (maxlen > 0)
3755  {
3756  /* make it shorter by removing a bit in the middle */
3757  if (vim_strsize(buf) > maxlen)
3758  trunc_string(buf, buf, maxlen, IOSIZE);
3759  }
3760  }
3761  }
3762  mustset = value_changed(title_str, &lasttitle);
3763 
3764  if (p_icon)
3765  {
3766  icon_str = buf;
3767  if (*p_iconstring != NUL)
3768  {
3769 #ifdef FEAT_STL_OPT
3770  if (stl_syntax & STL_IN_ICON)
3771  {
3772  int use_sandbox = FALSE;
3773  int save_called_emsg = called_emsg;
3774 
3775 # ifdef FEAT_EVAL
3776  use_sandbox = was_set_insecurely((char_u *)"iconstring", 0);
3777 # endif
3778  called_emsg = FALSE;
3779  build_stl_str_hl(curwin, icon_str, sizeof(buf),
3780  p_iconstring, use_sandbox,
3781  0, 0, NULL, NULL);
3782  if (called_emsg)
3783  set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"iconstring", -1,
3784  (char_u *)"", OPT_FREE, SID_ERROR);
3785  called_emsg |= save_called_emsg;
3786  }
3787  else
3788 #endif
3789  icon_str = p_iconstring;
3790  }
3791  else
3792  {
3793  if (buf_spname(curbuf) != NULL)
3794  p = buf_spname(curbuf);
3795  else /* use file name only in icon */
3796  p = gettail(curbuf->b_ffname);
3797  *icon_str = NUL;
3798  /* Truncate name at 100 bytes. */
3799  len = (int)STRLEN(p);
3800  if (len > 100)
3801  {
3802  len -= 100;
3803  if (has_mbyte)
3804  len += (*mb_tail_off)(p, p + len) + 1;
3805  p += len;
3806  }
3807  STRCPY(icon_str, p);
3808  trans_characters(icon_str, IOSIZE);
3809  }
3810  }
3811 
3812  mustset |= value_changed(icon_str, &lasticon);
3813 
3814  if (mustset)
3815  resettitle();
3816 }
3817 
3818 /*
3819  * Used for title and icon: Check if "str" differs from "*last". Set "*last"
3820  * from "str" if it does.
3821  * Return TRUE if resettitle() is to be called.
3822  */
3823  static int
3824 value_changed(char_u *str, char_u **last)
3825 {
3826  if ((str == NULL) != (*last == NULL)
3827  || (str != NULL && *last != NULL && STRCMP(str, *last) != 0))
3828  {
3829  vim_free(*last);
3830  if (str == NULL)
3831  {
3832  *last = NULL;
3833  mch_restore_title(
3834  last == &lasttitle ? SAVE_RESTORE_TITLE : SAVE_RESTORE_ICON);
3835  }
3836  else
3837  {
3838  *last = vim_strsave(str);
3839  return TRUE;
3840  }
3841  }
3842  return FALSE;
3843 }

3864 
3865 #if defined(FEAT_STL_OPT) || defined(FEAT_GUI_TABLINE) || defined(PROTO)
3866 /*
3867  * Build a string from the status line items in "fmt".
3868  * Return length of string in screen cells.
3869  *
3870  * Normally works for window "wp", except when working for 'tabline' then it
3871  * is "curwin".
3872  *
3873  * Items are drawn interspersed with the text that surrounds it
3874  * Specials: %-<wid>(xxx%) => group, %= => middle marker, %< => truncation
3875  * Item: %-<minwid>.<maxwid><itemch> All but <itemch> are optional
3876  *
3877  * If maxwidth is not zero, the string will be filled at any middle marker
3878  * or truncated if too long, fillchar is used for all whitespace.
3879  */
3880  int
3881 build_stl_str_hl(
3882  win_T *wp,
3883  char_u *out, /* buffer to write into != NameBuff */
3884  size_t outlen, /* length of out[] */
3885  char_u *fmt,
3886  int use_sandbox UNUSED, /* "fmt" was set insecurely, use sandbox */
3887  int fillchar,
3888  int maxwidth,
3889  struct stl_hlrec *hltab, /* return: HL attributes (can be NULL) */
3890  struct stl_hlrec *tabtab) /* return: tab page nrs (can be NULL) */
3891 {
3892  linenr_T lnum;
3893  size_t len;
3894  char_u *p;
3895  char_u *s;
3896  char_u *t;
3897  int byteval;
3898 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
3899  win_T *save_curwin;
3900  buf_T *save_curbuf;
3901 #endif
3902  int empty_line;
3903  colnr_T virtcol;
3904  long l;
3905  long n;
3906  int prevchar_isflag;
3907  int prevchar_isitem;
3908  int itemisflag;
3909  int fillable;
3910  char_u *str;
3911  long num;
3912  int width;
3913  int itemcnt;
3914  int curitem;
3915  int group_end_userhl;
3916  int group_start_userhl;
3917  int groupitem[STL_MAX_ITEM];
3918  int groupdepth;
3919  struct stl_item
3920  {
3921  char_u *start;
3922  int minwid;
3923  int maxwid;
3924  enum
3925  {
3926  Normal,
3927  Empty,
3928  Group,
3929  Middle,
3930  Highlight,
3931  TabPage,
3932  Trunc
3933  } type;
3934  } item[STL_MAX_ITEM];
3935  int minwid;
3936  int maxwid;

4009  {

4013  * to give the user a hint about what went wrong. */

4023  prevchar_isflag = prevchar_isitem = FALSE;

4027  */

4029  *p++ = *s++;

4031  break;

4034  * Handle one '%' item.
4035  */
4036  s++;
4037  if (*s == NUL) /* ignore trailing % */
4038  break;
4039  if (*s == '%')
4040  {
4041  if (p + 1 >= out + outlen)
4042  break;
4043  *p++ = *s++;
4044  prevchar_isflag = prevchar_isitem = FALSE;
4045  continue;

4072  l = vim_strsize(t);
4073  if (curitem > groupitem[groupdepth] + 1

4075  {

4079  for (n = groupitem[groupdepth] - 1; n >= 0; n--)
4080  {

4098  }

4100  if (l > item[groupitem[groupdepth]].maxwid)
4101  {
4102  /* truncate, remove n bytes of text at the start */
4103  if (has_mbyte)
4104  {
4105  /* Find the first character that should be included. */
4106  n = 0;
4107  while (l >= item[groupitem[groupdepth]].maxwid)
4108  {

4121  while (++l < item[groupitem[groupdepth]].minwid)

4139  n = 0 - n;

4142  }

4152  item[n].start += l;
4153  for ( ; l > 0; l--)
4154  *t++ = fillchar;
4155  }
4156  }
4157  continue;
4158  }

4160  maxwid = 9999;
4161  zeropad = FALSE;

4164  {

4167  }
4168  if (*s == '-')
4169  {
4170  s++;
4171  l = -1;
4172  }

4589  item[curitem].type = Empty;
4590 
4591  if (opt == STL_VIM_EXPR)
4592  vim_free(str);
4593 
4594  if (num >= 0 || (!itemisflag && str && *str))
4595  prevchar_isflag = FALSE; /* Item not NULL, but not a flag */
4596  curitem++;
4597  }
4598  *p = NUL;
4599  itemcnt = curitem;
4600 
4601 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4602  if (usefmt != fmt)
4603  vim_free(usefmt);
4604 #endif
4605 
4606  width = vim_strsize(out);
4607  if (maxwidth > 0 && width > maxwidth)
4608  {
4609  /* Result is too long, must truncate somewhere. */
4610  l = 0;
4611  if (itemcnt == 0)
4612  s = out;
4613  else
4614  {
4615  for ( ; l < itemcnt; l++)
4616  if (item[l].type == Trunc)
4617  {
4618  /* Truncate at %< item. */
4619  s = item[l].start;
4620  break;
4621  }
4622  if (l == itemcnt)
4623  {
4624  /* No %< item, truncate first item. */
4625  s = item[0].start;
4626  l = 0;
4627  }
4628  }
4629 
4630  if (width - vim_strsize(s) >= maxwidth)
4631  {
4632  /* Truncation mark is beyond max length */
4633  if (has_mbyte)
4634  {
4635  s = out;
4636  width = 0;
4637  for (;;)
4638  {
4639  width += ptr2cells(s);
4640  if (width >= maxwidth)
4641  break;
4642  s += (*mb_ptr2len)(s);
4643  }
4644  /* Fill up for half a double-wide character. */
4645  while (++width < maxwidth)
4646  *s++ = fillchar;
4647  }
4648  else
4649  s = out + maxwidth - 1;
4650  for (l = 0; l < itemcnt; l++)
4651  if (item[l].start > s)
4652  break;
4653  itemcnt = l;
4654  *s++ = '>';
4655  *s = 0;
4656  }
4657  else
4658  {
4659  if (has_mbyte)
4660  {
4661  n = 0;
4662  while (width >= maxwidth)
4663  {
4664  width -= ptr2cells(s + n);
4665  n += (*mb_ptr2len)(s + n);
4666  }
4667  }
4668  else
4669  n = width - maxwidth + 1;
4670  p = s + n;
4671  STRMOVE(s + 1, p);
4672  *s = '<';
4673 
4674  /* Fill up for half a double-wide character. */
4675  while (++width < maxwidth)
4676  {
4677  s = s + STRLEN(s);
4678  *s++ = fillchar;
4679  *s = NUL;
4680  }
4681 
4682  --n; /* count the '<' */
4683  for (; l < itemcnt; l++)
4684  {
4685  if (item[l].start - n >= s)
4686  item[l].start -= n;
4687  else
4688  item[l].start = s;
4689  }
4690  }
4691  width = maxwidth;
4692  }
4693  else if (width < maxwidth && STRLEN(out) + maxwidth - width + 1 < outlen)
4694  {
4695  /* Apply STL_MIDDLE if any */
4696  for (l = 0; l < itemcnt; l++)
4697  if (item[l].type == Middle)
4698  break;
4699  if (l < itemcnt)
4700  {
4701  p = item[l].start + maxwidth - width;
4702  STRMOVE(p, item[l].start);
4703  for (s = item[l].start; s < p; s++)
4704  *s = fillchar;
4705  for (l++; l < itemcnt; l++)
4706  item[l].start += maxwidth - width;
4707  width = maxwidth;
4708  }
4709  }
4710 
4711  /* Store the info about highlighting. */
4712  if (hltab != NULL)
4713  {
4714  sp = hltab;
4715  for (l = 0; l < itemcnt; l++)
4716  {
4717  if (item[l].type == Highlight)
4718  {
4719  sp->start = item[l].start;
4720  sp->userhl = item[l].minwid;
4721  sp++;
4722  }
4723  }
4724  sp->start = NULL;
4725  sp->userhl = 0;
4726  }
4727 
4728  /* Store the info about tab pages labels. */
4729  if (tabtab != NULL)
4730  {
4731  sp = tabtab;
4732  for (l = 0; l < itemcnt; l++)
4733  {
4734  if (item[l].type == TabPage)
4735  {
4736  sp->start = item[l].start;
4737  sp->userhl = item[l].minwid;
4738  sp++;
4739  }
4740  }
4741  sp->start = NULL;
4742  sp->userhl = 0;
4743  }
4744 
4745  /* When inside update_screen we do not want redrawing a stausline, ruler,
4746  * title, etc. to trigger another redraw, it may cause an endless loop. */
4747  if (updating_screen)
4748  {
4749  must_redraw = save_must_redraw;
4750  curwin->w_redr_type = save_redr_type;
4751  }
4752 
4753  return width;
4754 }
4755 #endif /* FEAT_STL_OPT */
4756 
4757 #if defined(FEAT_STL_OPT) || defined(FEAT_CMDL_INFO) \
4758  || defined(FEAT_GUI_TABLINE) || defined(PROTO)
4759 /*
4760  * Get relative cursor position in window into "buf[buflen]", in the form 99%,
4761  * using "Top", "Bot" or "All" when appropriate.
4762  */
4763  void
4764 get_rel_pos(
4765  win_T *wp,
4766  char_u *buf,
4767  int buflen)
4768 {
4769  long above; /* number of lines above window */
4770  long below; /* number of lines below window */
4771 
4772  if (buflen < 3) /* need at least 3 chars for writing */
4773  return;
4774  above = wp->w_topline - 1;
4775 #ifdef FEAT_DIFF
4776  above += diff_check_fill(wp, wp->w_topline) - wp->w_topfill;
4777  if (wp->w_topline == 1 && wp->w_topfill >= 1)
4778  above = 0; /* All buffer lines are displayed and there is an
4779  * indication of filler lines, that can be considered
4780  * seeing all lines. */
4781 #endif
4782  below = wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count - wp->w_botline + 1;
4783  if (below <= 0)
4784  vim_strncpy(buf, (char_u *)(above == 0 ? _("All") : _("Bot")),
4785  (size_t)(buflen - 1));
4786  else if (above <= 0)
4787  vim_strncpy(buf, (char_u *)_("Top"), (size_t)(buflen - 1));
4788  else
4789  vim_snprintf((char *)buf, (size_t)buflen, "%2d%%", above > 1000000L
4790  ? (int)(above / ((above + below) / 100L))
4791  : (int)(above * 100L / (above + below)));
4792 }
4793 #endif
4794 
4795 /*
4796  * Append (file 2 of 8) to "buf[buflen]", if editing more than one file.
4797  * Return TRUE if it was appended.
4798  */
4799  static int
4800 append_arg_number(
4801  win_T *wp,
4802  char_u *buf,
4803  int buflen,
4804  int add_file) /* Add "file" before the arg number */
4805 {
4806  char_u *p;
4807 
4808  if (ARGCOUNT <= 1) /* nothing to do */
4809  return FALSE;
4810 
4811  p = buf + STRLEN(buf); /* go to the end of the buffer */
4812  if (p - buf + 35 >= buflen) /* getting too long */
4813  return FALSE;
4814  *p++ = ' ';
4815  *p++ = '(';
4816  if (add_file)
4817  {
4818  STRCPY(p, "file ");
4819  p += 5;
4820  }
4821  vim_snprintf((char *)p, (size_t)(buflen - (p - buf)),
4822  wp->w_arg_idx_invalid ? "(%d) of %d)"
4823  : "%d of %d)", wp->w_arg_idx + 1, ARGCOUNT);
4824  return TRUE;
4825 }

4827 /*
4828  * If fname is not a full path, make it a full path.
4829  * Returns pointer to allocated memory (NULL for failure).
4830  */
4831  char_u *
4832 fix_fname(char_u *fname)
4833 {
4834  /*
4835  * Force expanding the path always for Unix, because symbolic links may
4836  * mess up the full path name, even though it starts with a '/'.
4837  * Also expand when there is ".." in the file name, try to remove it,
4838  * because "c:/src/../README" is equal to "c:/README".
4839  * Similarly "c:/src//file" is equal to "c:/src/file".
4840  * For MS-Windows also expand names like "longna~1" to "longname".
4841  */
4842 #ifdef UNIX
4843  return FullName_save(fname, TRUE);
4844 #else
4845  if (!vim_isAbsName(fname)
4846  || strstr((char *)fname, "..") != NULL
4847  || strstr((char *)fname, "//") != NULL
4848 # ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
4849  || strstr((char *)fname, "\\\\") != NULL
4850 # endif
4851 # if defined(MSWIN)
4852  || vim_strchr(fname, '~') != NULL
4853 # endif
4854  )
4855  return FullName_save(fname, FALSE);
4856 
4857  fname = vim_strsave(fname);
4858 
4859 # ifdef USE_FNAME_CASE
4860  if (fname != NULL)
4861  fname_case(fname, 0); /* set correct case for file name */
4862 # endif
4863 
4864  return fname;
4865 #endif
4866 }
4867 
4868 /*
4869  * Make "*ffname" a full file name, set "*sfname" to "*ffname" if not NULL.
4870  * "*ffname" becomes a pointer to allocated memory (or NULL).
4871  * When resolving a link both "*sfname" and "*ffname" will point to the same
4872  * allocated memory.
4873  * The "*ffname" and "*sfname" pointer values on call will not be freed.
4874  * Note that the resulting "*ffname" pointer should be considered not allocaed.
4875  */
4876  void
4877 fname_expand(
4878  buf_T *buf UNUSED,
4879  char_u **ffname,
4880  char_u **sfname)
4881 {
4882  if (*ffname == NULL) // no file name given, nothing to do
4883  return;
4884  if (*sfname == NULL) // no short file name given, use ffname
4885  *sfname = *ffname;
4886  *ffname = fix_fname(*ffname); // expand to full path
4887 
4888 #ifdef FEAT_SHORTCUT
4889  if (!buf->b_p_bin)
4890  {
4891  char_u *rfname;
4892 
4893  // If the file name is a shortcut file, use the file it links to.
4894  rfname = mch_resolve_path(*ffname, FALSE);
4895  if (rfname != NULL)
4896  {
4897  vim_free(*ffname);
4898  *ffname = rfname;
4899  *sfname = rfname;
4900  }
4901  }
4902 #endif
4903 }
4904 
4905 /*
4906  * Open a window for a number of buffers.
4907  */
4908  void
4909 ex_buffer_all(exarg_T *eap)
4910 {
4911  buf_T *buf;
4912  win_T *wp, *wpnext;
4913  int split_ret = OK;
4914  int p_ea_save;
4915  int open_wins = 0;
4916  int r;
4917  int count; /* Maximum number of windows to open. */
4918  int all; /* When TRUE also load inactive buffers. */
4919  int had_tab = cmdmod.tab;
4920  tabpage_T *tpnext;
4921 
4922  if (eap->addr_count == 0) /* make as many windows as possible */
4923  count = 9999;
4924  else
4925  count = eap->line2; /* make as many windows as specified */
4926  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_unhide || eap->cmdidx == CMD_sunhide)
4927  all = FALSE;
4928  else
4929  all = TRUE;
4930 
4931  setpcmark();
4932 
4933 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
4934  need_mouse_correct = TRUE;
4935 #endif
4936 
4937  /*
4938  * Close superfluous windows (two windows for the same buffer).
4939  * Also close windows that are not full-width.
4940  */
4941  if (had_tab > 0)
4942  goto_tabpage_tp(first_tabpage, TRUE, TRUE);
4943  for (;;)
4944  {
4945  tpnext = curtab->tp_next;
4946  for (wp = firstwin; wp != NULL; wp = wpnext)
4947  {
4948  wpnext = wp->w_next;
4949  if ((wp->w_buffer->b_nwindows > 1
4950  || ((cmdmod.split & WSP_VERT)
4951  ? wp->w_height + wp->w_status_height < Rows - p_ch
4952  - tabline_height()
4953  : wp->w_width != Columns)
4954  || (had_tab > 0 && wp != firstwin)) && !ONE_WINDOW
4955  && !(wp->w_closing || wp->w_buffer->b_locked > 0))
4956  {
4957  win_close(wp, FALSE);
4958  wpnext = firstwin; /* just in case an autocommand does
4959  something strange with windows */
4960  tpnext = first_tabpage; /* start all over... */
4961  open_wins = 0;
4962  }
4963  else
4964  ++open_wins;
4965  }
4966 
4967  /* Without the ":tab" modifier only do the current tab page. */
4968  if (had_tab == 0 || tpnext == NULL)
4969  break;
4970  goto_tabpage_tp(tpnext, TRUE, TRUE);
4971  }
4972 
4973  /*
4974  * Go through the buffer list. When a buffer doesn't have a window yet,
4975  * open one. Otherwise move the window to the right position.
4976  * Watch out for autocommands that delete buffers or windows!
4977  */
4978  /* Don't execute Win/Buf Enter/Leave autocommands here. */
4979  ++autocmd_no_enter;
4980  win_enter(lastwin, FALSE);
4981  ++autocmd_no_leave;
4982  for (buf = firstbuf; buf != NULL && open_wins < count; buf = buf->b_next)
4983  {
4984  /* Check if this buffer needs a window */
4985  if ((!all && buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL) || !buf->b_p_bl)
4986  continue;
4987 
4988  if (had_tab != 0)
4989  {
4990  /* With the ":tab" modifier don't move the window. */
4991  if (buf->b_nwindows > 0)
4992  wp = lastwin; /* buffer has a window, skip it */
4993  else
4994  wp = NULL;
4995  }
4996  else
4997  {
4998  /* Check if this buffer already has a window */
4999  FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)
5000  if (wp->w_buffer == buf)
5001  break;
5002  /* If the buffer already has a window, move it */
5003  if (wp != NULL)
5004  win_move_after(wp, curwin);
5005  }
5006 
5007  if (wp == NULL && split_ret == OK)
5008  {
5009  bufref_T bufref;
5010 
5011  set_bufref(&bufref, buf);
5012 
5013  /* Split the window and put the buffer in it */
5014  p_ea_save = p_ea;
5015  p_ea = TRUE; /* use space from all windows */
5016  split_ret = win_split(0, WSP_ROOM | WSP_BELOW);
5017  ++open_wins;
5018  p_ea = p_ea_save;
5019  if (split_ret == FAIL)
5020  continue;
5021 
5022  /* Open the buffer in this window. */
5023  swap_exists_action = SEA_DIALOG;
5024  set_curbuf(buf, DOBUF_GOTO);
5025  if (!bufref_valid(&bufref))
5026  {
5027  /* autocommands deleted the buffer!!! */
5028  swap_exists_action = SEA_NONE;
5029  break;
5030  }
5031  if (swap_exists_action == SEA_QUIT)
5032  {
5033 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL)
5034  cleanup_T cs;
5035 
5036  /* Reset the error/interrupt/exception state here so that
5037  * aborting() returns FALSE when closing a window. */
5038  enter_cleanup(&cs);
5039 #endif
5040 
5041  /* User selected Quit at ATTENTION prompt; close this window. */
5042  win_close(curwin, TRUE);
5043  --open_wins;
5044  swap_exists_action = SEA_NONE;
5045  swap_exists_did_quit = TRUE;
5046 
5047 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL)
5048  /* Restore the error/interrupt/exception state if not
5049  * discarded by a new aborting error, interrupt, or uncaught
5050  * exception. */
5051  leave_cleanup(&cs);
5052 #endif
5053  }
5054  else
5055  handle_swap_exists(NULL);
5056  }
5057 
5058  ui_breakcheck();
5059  if (got_int)
5060  {
5061  (void)vgetc(); /* only break the file loading, not the rest */
5062  break;
5063  }
5064 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
5065  /* Autocommands deleted the buffer or aborted script processing!!! */
5066  if (aborting())
5067  break;
5068 #endif
5069  /* When ":tab" was used open a new tab for a new window repeatedly. */
5070  if (had_tab > 0 && tabpage_index(NULL) <= p_tpm)
5071  cmdmod.tab = 9999;
5072  }
5073  --autocmd_no_enter;
5074  win_enter(firstwin, FALSE); /* back to first window */
5075  --autocmd_no_leave;
5076 
5077  /*
5078  * Close superfluous windows.
5079  */
5080  for (wp = lastwin; open_wins > count; )
5081  {
5082  r = (buf_hide(wp->w_buffer) || !bufIsChanged(wp->w_buffer)
5083  || autowrite(wp->w_buffer, FALSE) == OK);
5084  if (!win_valid(wp))
5085  {
5086  /* BufWrite Autocommands made the window invalid, start over */
5087  wp = lastwin;
5088  }
5089  else if (r)
5090  {
5091  win_close(wp, !buf_hide(wp->w_buffer));
5092  --open_wins;
5093  wp = lastwin;
5094  }
5095  else
5096  {
5097  wp = wp->w_prev;
5098  if (wp == NULL)
5099  break;
5100  }
5101  }
5102 }
5103 
5104 
5105 static int chk_modeline(linenr_T, int);
5106 
5107 /*
5108  * do_modelines() - process mode lines for the current file
5109  *
5110  * "flags" can be:
5111  * OPT_WINONLY only set options local to window
5112  * OPT_NOWIN don't set options local to window
5113  *
5114  * Returns immediately if the "ml" option isn't set.
5115  */
5116  void
5117 do_modelines(int flags)
5118 {
5119  linenr_T lnum;
5120  int nmlines;
5121  static int entered = 0;
5122 
5123  if (!curbuf->b_p_ml || (nmlines = (int)p_mls) == 0)
5124  return;
5125 
5126  /* Disallow recursive entry here. Can happen when executing a modeline
5127  * triggers an autocommand, which reloads modelines with a ":do". */
5128  if (entered)
5129  return;
5130 
5131  ++entered;
5132  for (lnum = 1; lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count && lnum <= nmlines;
5133  ++lnum)
5134  if (chk_modeline(lnum, flags) == FAIL)
5135  nmlines = 0;
5136 
5137  for (lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count; lnum > 0 && lnum > nmlines
5138  && lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count - nmlines; --lnum)
5139  if (chk_modeline(lnum, flags) == FAIL)
5140  nmlines = 0;
5141  --entered;
5142 }
5143 
5144 #include "version.h" /* for version number */
5145 
5146 /*
5147  * chk_modeline() - check a single line for a mode string
5148  * Return FAIL if an error encountered.
5149  */
5150  static int
5151 chk_modeline(
5152  linenr_T lnum,
5153  int flags) /* Same as for do_modelines(). */
5154 {
5155  char_u *s;
5156  char_u *e;
5157  char_u *linecopy; /* local copy of any modeline found */
5158  int prev;
5159  int vers;
5160  int end;
5161  int retval = OK;
5162  char_u *save_sourcing_name;
5163  linenr_T save_sourcing_lnum;
5164 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
5165  sctx_T save_current_sctx;
5166 #endif
5167 
5168  prev = -1;
5169  for (s = ml_get(lnum); *s != NUL; ++s)
5170  {
5171  if (prev == -1 || vim_isspace(prev))
5172  {
5173  if ((prev != -1 && STRNCMP(s, "ex:", (size_t)3) == 0)
5174  || STRNCMP(s, "vi:", (size_t)3) == 0)
5175  break;
5176  /* Accept both "vim" and "Vim". */
5177  if ((s[0] == 'v' || s[0] == 'V') && s[1] == 'i' && s[2] == 'm')
5178  {
5179  if (s[3] == '<' || s[3] == '=' || s[3] == '>')
5180  e = s + 4;
5181  else
5182  e = s + 3;
5183  vers = getdigits(&e);
5184  if (*e == ':'
5185  && (s[0] != 'V'
5186  || STRNCMP(skipwhite(e + 1), "set", 3) == 0)
5187  && (s[3] == ':'
5188  || (VIM_VERSION_100 >= vers && isdigit(s[3]))
5189  || (VIM_VERSION_100 < vers && s[3] == '<')
5190  || (VIM_VERSION_100 > vers && s[3] == '>')
5191  || (VIM_VERSION_100 == vers && s[3] == '=')))
5192  break;
5193  }
5194  }
5195  prev = *s;
5196  }
5197 
5198  if (*s)
5199  {
5200  do /* skip over "ex:", "vi:" or "vim:" */
5201  ++s;
5202  while (s[-1] != ':');
5203 
5204  s = linecopy = vim_strsave(s); /* copy the line, it will change */
5205  if (linecopy == NULL)
5206  return FAIL;
5207 
5208  save_sourcing_lnum = sourcing_lnum;
5209  save_sourcing_name = sourcing_name;
5210  sourcing_lnum = lnum; /* prepare for emsg() */
5211  sourcing_name = (char_u *)"modelines";
5212 
5213  end = FALSE;
5214  while (end == FALSE)
5215  {
5216  s = skipwhite(s);
5217  if (*s == NUL)
5218  break;
5219 
5220  /*
5221  * Find end of set command: ':' or end of line.
5222  * Skip over "\:", replacing it with ":".
5223  */
5224  for (e = s; *e != ':' && *e != NUL; ++e)
5225  if (e[0] == '\\' && e[1] == ':')
5226  STRMOVE(e, e + 1);
5227  if (*e == NUL)
5228  end = TRUE;
5229 
5230  /*
5231  * If there is a "set" command, require a terminating ':' and
5232  * ignore the stuff after the ':'.
5233  * "vi:set opt opt opt: foo" -- foo not interpreted
5234  * "vi:opt opt opt: foo" -- foo interpreted
5235  * Accept "se" for compatibility with Elvis.
5236  */
5237  if (STRNCMP(s, "set ", (size_t)4) == 0
5238  || STRNCMP(s, "se ", (size_t)3) == 0)
5239  {
5240  if (*e != ':') /* no terminating ':'? */
5241  break;
5242  end = TRUE;
5243  s = vim_strchr(s, ' ') + 1;
5244  }
5245  *e = NUL; /* truncate the set command */
5246 
5247  if (*s != NUL) /* skip over an empty "::" */
5248  {
5249  int secure_save = secure;
5250 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
5251  save_current_sctx = current_sctx;
5252  current_sctx.sc_sid = SID_MODELINE;
5253  current_sctx.sc_seq = 0;
5254  current_sctx.sc_lnum = 0;
5255  current_sctx.sc_version = 1;
5256 #endif
5257  // Make sure no risky things are executed as a side effect.
5258  secure = 1;
5259 
5260  retval = do_set(s, OPT_MODELINE | OPT_LOCAL | flags);
5261 
5262  secure = secure_save;
5263 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
5264  current_sctx = save_current_sctx;
5265 #endif
5266  if (retval == FAIL) /* stop if error found */
5267  break;
5268  }
5269  s = e + 1; /* advance to next part */
5270  }
5271 
5272  sourcing_lnum = save_sourcing_lnum;
5273  sourcing_name = save_sourcing_name;
5274 
5275  vim_free(linecopy);
5276  }
5277  return retval;
5278 }

5386 /*
5387  * Return TRUE if the buffer should be hidden, according to 'hidden', ":hide"
5388  * and 'bufhidden'.
5389  */
5390  int
5391 buf_hide(buf_T *buf)
5392 {
5393  /* 'bufhidden' overrules 'hidden' and ":hide", check it first */
5394  switch (buf->b_p_bh[0])
5395  {
5396  case 'u': /* "unload" */
5397  case 'w': /* "wipe" */
5398  case 'd': return FALSE; /* "delete" */
5399  case 'h': return TRUE; /* "hide" */
5400  }
5401  return (p_hid || cmdmod.hide);
5402 }

5404 /*
5405  * Return special buffer name.
5406  * Returns NULL when the buffer has a normal file name.
5407  */
5408  char_u *
5409 buf_spname(buf_T *buf)
5410 {
5411 #if defined(FEAT_QUICKFIX)
5412  if (bt_quickfix(buf))
5413  {
5414  /*
5415  * Differentiate between the quickfix and location list buffers using
5416  * the buffer number stored in the global quickfix stack.
5417  */
5418  if (buf->b_fnum == qf_stack_get_bufnr())
5419  return (char_u *)_(msg_qflist);
5420  else
5421  return (char_u *)_(msg_loclist);
5422  }
5423 #endif
5424 
5425  /* There is no _file_ when 'buftype' is "nofile", b_sfname
5426  * contains the name as specified by the user. */
5427  if (bt_nofilename(buf))
5428  {
5429 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
5430  if (buf->b_term != NULL)
5431  return term_get_status_text(buf->b_term);
5432 #endif
5433  if (buf->b_fname != NULL)
5434  return buf->b_fname;
5435 #ifdef FEAT_JOB_CHANNEL
5436  if (bt_prompt(buf))
5437  return (char_u *)_("[Prompt]");
5438 #endif
5439 #ifdef FEAT_TEXT_PROP
5440  if (bt_popup(buf))
5441  return (char_u *)_("[Popup]");
5442 #endif
5443  return (char_u *)_("[Scratch]");
5444  }
5445 
5446  if (buf->b_fname == NULL)
5447  return (char_u *)_("[No Name]");
5448  return NULL;
5449 }

5451 /*
5452  * Set 'buflisted' for curbuf to "on" and trigger autocommands if it changed.
5453  */
5454  void
5455 set_buflisted(int on)
5456 {
5457  if (on != curbuf->b_p_bl)
5458  {
5459  curbuf->b_p_bl = on;
5460  if (on)
5461  apply_autocmds(EVENT_BUFADD, NULL, NULL, FALSE, curbuf);
5462  else
5463  apply_autocmds(EVENT_BUFDELETE, NULL, NULL, FALSE, curbuf);
5464  }
5465 }
5466 
5467 /*
5468  * Read the file for "buf" again and check if the contents changed.
5469  * Return TRUE if it changed or this could not be checked.
5470  */
5471  int
5472 buf_contents_changed(buf_T *buf)
5473 {
5474  buf_T *newbuf;
5475  int differ = TRUE;
5476  linenr_T lnum;
5477  aco_save_T aco;
5478  exarg_T ea;
5479 
5480  /* Allocate a buffer without putting it in the buffer list. */
5481  newbuf = buflist_new(NULL, NULL, (linenr_T)1, BLN_DUMMY);
5482  if (newbuf == NULL)
5483  return TRUE;
5484 
5485  /* Force the 'fileencoding' and 'fileformat' to be equal. */
5486  if (prep_exarg(&ea, buf) == FAIL)
5487  {
5488  wipe_buffer(newbuf, FALSE);
5489  return TRUE;
5490  }
5491 
5492  /* set curwin/curbuf to buf and save a few things */
5493  aucmd_prepbuf(&aco, newbuf);
5494 
5495  if (ml_open(curbuf) == OK
5496  && readfile(buf->b_ffname, buf->b_fname,
5497  (linenr_T)0, (linenr_T)0, (linenr_T)MAXLNUM,
5498  &ea, READ_NEW | READ_DUMMY) == OK)
5499  {
5500  /* compare the two files line by line */
5501  if (buf->b_ml.ml_line_count == curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
5502  {
5503  differ = FALSE;
5504  for (lnum = 1; lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count; ++lnum)
5505  if (STRCMP(ml_get_buf(buf, lnum, FALSE), ml_get(lnum)) != 0)
5506  {
5507  differ = TRUE;
5508  break;
5509  }
5510  }
5511  }
5512  vim_free(ea.cmd);
5513 
5514  /* restore curwin/curbuf and a few other things */
5515  aucmd_restbuf(&aco);
5516 
5517  if (curbuf != newbuf) /* safety check */
5518  wipe_buffer(newbuf, FALSE);
5519 
5520  return differ;
5521 }
5522 
5523 /*
5524  * Wipe out a buffer and decrement the last buffer number if it was used for
5525  * this buffer. Call this to wipe out a temp buffer that does not contain any
5526  * marks.
5527  */
5528  void
5529 wipe_buffer(
5530  buf_T *buf,
5531  int aucmd UNUSED) /* When TRUE trigger autocommands. */
5532 {
5533  if (buf->b_fnum == top_file_num - 1)
5534  --top_file_num;
5535 
5536  if (!aucmd) /* Don't trigger BufDelete autocommands here. */
5537  block_autocmds();
5538 
5539  close_buffer(NULL, buf, DOBUF_WIPE, FALSE);
5540 
5541  if (!aucmd)
5542  unblock_autocmds();
5543 }
